metadata.title: CVE-2022-25326 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
fscrypt through v0.3.2 creates a world-writable directory by default when setting up a filesystem, allowing unprivileged users to exhaust filesystem space. We recommend upgrading to fscrypt 0.3.3 or above and adjusting the permissions on existing fscrypt metadata directories where applicable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25326` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fscrypt - 0.3.3-1
libpam-fscrypt - 0.3.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fscrypt package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.3-1').
